Dear Mr. Whitney:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. If you do not contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must indicate so in writing; this may be included in your corrective
action plan or in a separate document. If you contest the issuance of a provisional license,
you must notify this office in writing and an administrative hearing will be scheduled. Even
if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable
corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION: Resident was assaulted by staff member. Resident sustained a
scratch on his neck and a bloody lip.
INVESTIGATION:
Allegation was made that Staff 1 got into a physical altercation with Youth A and Youth
A received minor scratches and a bloody lip.
I interviewed State Worker 1 and State Worker 2 by telephone on 05/11/2020 and State
Worker 1 again on 05/12/2020. State Worker 1 stated she interviewed Youth A on
05/11/2020 and a video was available of the incident. I reviewed the video and it
showed Youth A and Staff 1 having a confrontation with Staff 1 pointing at Youth A.
Youth A was approaching Staff 1 on the video and swinging at Staff 1. Staff 1
responded by swinging at Youth A which resulted in a struggle between the them.
Other staff in the area moved in and separated Staff 1 and Youth A, and escorted Staff
1 away from the area.
2

Administrator 1 submitted the video, written statements by Staff 2, and Staff 3, and the
training record for Staff 1 on 05/12/2020.
In her written statement Staff 2 stated she was in class with Youth A. Staff 1 was
getting the residents secure to have lunch. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 was expressing how
Staff 1 felt about the day when Youth A went to the front of the line. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 was pointing his finger in the face of Youth A and hit Youth A in his eye. Staff 2
reported Youth A then began to swing at Staff 1.
Staff 3 reported in her written statement that she was in the office and heard Staff 1 tell
Youth A to “motivate” as they were always waiting on his “bitch ass”. Staff 3 stated she
confronted Staff 1 and told him he could not say that to Youth A. Staff 3 described Staff
1 pointing his finger in the face of Youth A. Staff 1 and Youth A began to tussle and
fight. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 attempted to intervene and stop the fight.
I interviewed Administrator 1 at the facility on 06/24/2020 and Administrator 1 stated he
was the person that was able to get between Youth A and Staff 1 to stop their fight.
Administrator 1 stated Staff 1 was immediately relieved and has been subsequently
terminated.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 06/24/2020. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 was pointing his
finger at Youth A and she thought Youth A did walk into Staff 1 pointing his finger. Staff
2 stated she did not know who the staff member was that separated Staff 1 and Youth
A. This statement is also reflected in the written report from Staff 2.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 06/24/2020. Youth A stated he was upset and
wanted to finish a quiz in school when Staff 1 was talking to Youth A. Youth A stated
Staff 1 poked at Youth A but did not have contact with Youth A initially. Youth A stated
he then hit Staff 1 and Staff 1 started to strangle Youth A and they fought. Youth A
stated other staff intervened, restrained Youth A, and put Staff 1 in the office. Youth A
stated he was not hurt other than having a bloody lip and did not need any other
treatment.
The training record for Staff 1 that was reviewed indicated Staff 1 completed a refresher
course on Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) training 08/30/2019 and training for de-
escalation on 12/06/2019.
Administrator 1 submitted incident reports and an Employee Counseling Form. The
incident reports were consistent with the descriptions reported in interviews and the
video that was reviewed. The Employee Counseling Form dated 05/11/2020
documented that Staff 1 was terminated effective immediately.
I completed a telephone conference on 06/10/2020 with State Worker 2 and it was
agreed that Staff 1 is deemed unsuitable for the position to which he was assigned.
3

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any
manner.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation indicate that Staff 1 engaged in
a physical altercation/corporal punishment with Youth A in
violation of the facility’s discipline policies and this rule. This
determination was substantiated by the video reviewed,
documentation received, and the interviews that were completed
as a part of this investigation.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED-SIR #2020CO325004
dated 06/26/2019, CAP approved 12/15/2019.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
